result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bessie A Ortega

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bessie A Ortega not in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Bessie A Ortega.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense informed the Court that the defendant is in custody in Lake County, IL.  Court set a plea/sentencing and calendar call date.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Branch 40 is down.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Bessie A Ortega in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn on behalf of Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjourned plea hearing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bessie A Ortega in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bessie A Ortega in court with Attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (1/21/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohls Department Stores and Target Stores in Milwaukee County.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bessie A Ortega in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Bessie A Ortega
Current: 1535 S 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 01-19-2022)
Prior: 5812 West Mitchell Street,7, West Allis, WI 53214
